column1: MFK Zemplín Michalovce (Slovak pronunciation: [ˈzɛmpliːn ˈmixalɔʊ̯tsɛ]) is a Slovak football team
column2: based in the town of Michalovce who are playing in the Fortuna Liga
column3: the top tier in the Slovak football league system

column1: Zemplín Michalovce was formed in 1912. Football in Michalovce first played in the summer of 1912
column2: where Michalovce loss against FK Pozdišovce 0–6. The second club
column3: which was based in Michalovce is called NAC Michalovce (Nagymihályi athlétikai club) in 1914.

column2: they defeated their main rival MFK Skalica in a decisive match 2–0 away win
column3: secured their first place and a historic promotion to the Fortuna Liga.

column1: The following clubs are affiliated with Zemplín Michalovce:
MFK Zemplín's biggest rivals are clubs from eastern Slovakia as 1. FC Tatran Prešov
column4: 1. HFC Humenné and near TJ FK Veľké Revištia. Smaller rivalry is with other teams from the east
column9: ŠK Odeva Lipany. MFK Zemplín Michalovce supporters called Ultras Zemplín Michalovce (GS-52) maintain friendly relations with fans of VSS Košice called as Viva Košice.
